title.narrative: SSC Energy Sector, Indonesia - Phase II

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy aims to assist Indonesian government agencies and other relevant stakeholders in developing strategies, policies and solutions to support the implementation of Indonesia’s Nationally Determined Contributions under the UNFCCC as well as national targets for electrification, renewable energy and energy efficiency through:
- A strengthened capacity and technical studies on energy modelling and long-term energy planning for low carbon development at national level - An update of the technology catalogue for power production -recommendations on how to improve the policy and regulatory environment in Indonesia. - improved enabling environment for production of renewable energy - improved capacity and enforcement of minimum energy performance standards in buildings and appliances - improved enabling environment for implementation of national and provincial strategies for energy efficiency, hereunder the 6000 toe program.

The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Energy is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Energy Agency and the Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources. Through the project, the Indonesian Ministry will improve the energy framework conditions in order to reach national and international targets for electrification, renewable energy and energy efficiency.
A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

title.narrative: Not applicable as baseline, impact indicators are not defined for current SSC projects.
